key_risks: Legal and regulatory challenges, including overtime pay lawsuits and hiring discrimination settlements
Economic sensitivity due to dependence on corporate spending in technology and finance
Talent shortages in technology and finance sectors
Competitive pressures in the staffing industry
controversies: Overtime Pay Lawsuit: Allegations of FLSA violations for failing to pay recruiters overtime wages
Hiring Discrimination Settlement: $900,000 settlement with the U.S. Department of Justice for discriminating against non-U.S. citizens in job postings
social_issues: Potential reputational damage from legal controversies
governance_issues: Effectiveness of governance framework questioned due to recent legal issues
Need for improved compliance and ethical practices

sources.title: Kforce Shortchanged Recruiters on Overtime Pay, Lawsuit Says (1)
sources.snippet: COMPANY INFO: Kforce Inc. (Bloomberg Law Subscription) Staffing company Kforce Inc. is facing accusations that it violated the Fair Labor Standards Act by cheating recruiters across the country out of overtime wages in a lawsuit recently filed in a federal court in Florida.

sources.title: Whiteman v. Kforce Inc., 8:22-cv-56-VMC-CPT - Casetext
sources.snippet: Whiteman initiated this Fair Labor Standards Act ("FLSA") action against his former employer, Kforce, on January 6, 2022. (Doc. # 1). He filed the amended complaint, asserting an unpaid overtime claim under the FLSA on behalf of a collective of other Kforce employees, on March 18, 2022.

sources.title: Staffing Agency to Pay $900,000 to Settle Hiring Bias Claims (1)
sources.snippet: Staffing agency Kforce Inc. will pay $900,000 to settle claims that its hiring practices discriminated against non-US citizen job seekers, the Department of Justice announced Wednesday.. The Tampa, Fla.-based company will pay $690,000 in civil penalties and $230,000 in compensation to workers under the settlement.

sources.snippet: NEW YORK, NY (September 16, 2024) - Kforce (NYSE: KFRC) proudly rang The Opening Bell® at the New York Stock Exchange today to celebrate the transfer of its stock listing.
